bwwExcerpt: The audience giggles a fair amount at this story that ends in brutal deaths — from start to finish. nycTheatreExcerpt: "It's weird. "Othello" isn't witty "Hamlet." The play is not even as funny as "Macbeth." Maybe it's because they're in the presence of celebrities. But I get the sense that the viewers are searching for something  anything  to grasp onto on this long, chilly ride they maxed out their credit cards to sit through. And they choose laughter. Laughs in lieu of gasps or tears."
